TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NetMsmqSecurityMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The NetMsmqSecurityMode enumeration specifies security modes that can be used by the MSMQ transport.

remarks.format:
## Remarks MSMQ transport security secures messages using MSMQ. SOAP security secures messages using the WS-* security protocols. This property determines the mechanisms by which transfer security functions (such as integrity, confidentiality and authentication) are obtained.
## Examples The following code shows how to specify the security mode for a <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding> binding.
[!code-cs[S_UENetMsmqBinding#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.servicemodel.ne_5_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurityMode Both = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Enables both MSMQ transport security and SOAP security.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurityMode Message = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurityMode None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Disables both MSMQ transport security and SOAP security.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurityMode Transport = int32(1)
